name: Markha Valley Trek
details: This trek follows a circular route around Hemis National Park, offering a thrilling adventure with two high-altitude passes (4800-5000m) and waist-deep river crossings. The campsites are nestled among aromatic shrubs and wild roses, and trekkers may spot blue sheep, marmots, and other wildlife. The Markha Valley trek is one of the most sought-after treks in Ladakh, offering a mix of natural beauty and cultural richness.

Two high-altitude passes (4800-5000m)

name: Rumtse Tsomoriri Trek
details: This high-altitude trek starts from Rumtse (70 km east of Leh) and traverses the stunning Rupshu Valley. The region is characterized by arid plains, snow-capped peaks, and vibrant blue lakes such as Tsokar and Tsomoriri (4500m). The trek offers an insight into the nomadic culture of the Changthang Plateau and some of Ladakh's most breathtaking landscapes.
highlights: Explore the stunning Rupshu Valley
Experience the nomadic culture of the Changthang Plateau
Visit vibrant blue lakes Tsokar and Tsomoriri
Trek through high-altitude plains and snow-capped peaks

name: Spituk Trek
details: One of the easiest treks in Ladakh, the Spituk trek offers an excellent opportunity to explore ancient monasteries and culturally rich villages. The trek, accessible from Leh, includes a climb to Stok La at 4,900 meters and offers stunning views of peaks like Stok Kangri (6,115m), Kang Yatse (6,400m), and the Zanskar Range. From high passes, one can also witness the Karakoram and Nun Kun Range (above 7,000m).

details: Leh Ladakh, with its rugged terrain, breathtaking landscapes, and glacial rivers, offers one of the most exhilarating river rafting experiences in India. Flowing through deep gorges, scenic valleys, and challenging rapids, the rivers of Ladakh provide an unparalleled mix of adventure and natural beauty. Whether you are a seasoned rafter or a first-time adventurer, rafting in Ladakh is an experience you will never forget.
